collections.name: Sahih al-Bukhari
collections.description: The most authentic collection of hadith, compiled by Imam al-Bukhari (810-870 CE). Contains 7,563 hadiths selected from over 600,000, with the strictest criteria for authenticity.

collections.name: Sahih Muslim
collections.description: The second most authentic hadith collection, compiled by Imam Muslim (817-875 CE). Contains approximately 7,500 hadiths organized by legal topics with meticulous chain verification.

collections.name: Sunan Abu Dawud
collections.description: Focused on legal hadiths and jurisprudence, compiled by Imam Abu Dawud (817-889 CE). Contains 5,274 hadiths covering all aspects of Islamic law.

collections.name: Jami at-Tirmidhi
collections.description: A comprehensive collection compiled by Imam at-Tirmidhi (824-892 CE). Contains 3,956 hadiths with detailed commentary on the authenticity grading of each narration.

collections.name: Sunan an-Nasa'i
collections.description: Known for its strict authentication standards, compiled by Imam an-Nasa'i (829-915 CE). Contains 5,758 hadiths focusing on legal rulings and Islamic practices.

collections.name: Sunan Ibn Majah
collections.description: The sixth of the authentic collections, compiled by Imam Ibn Majah (824-887 CE). Contains 4,341 hadiths including unique narrations not found in other collections.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّمَا الأَعْمَالُ بِالنِّيَّاتِ، وَإِنَّمَا لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مَا نَوَى، فَمَنْ كَانَتْ هِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ فَهِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ، وَمَنْ كَانَتْ هِجْرَتُهُ لِدُنْيَا يُصِيبُهَا أَوْ امْرَأَةٍ يَنْكِحُهَا فَهِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى مَا هَاجَرَ إِلَيْهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The reward of deeds depends upon the intentions, and every person will be rewarded according to what he has intended. So whoever emigrated for Allah and His Messenger, his emigration was for Allah and His Messenger; and whoever emigrated for worldly benefits or for a woman to marry, his emigration was for what he emigrated for.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ يُؤْمِنُ أَحَدُكُمْ حَتَّى يُحِبَّ لأَخِيهِ مَا يُحِبُّ لِنَفْسِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُسْلِمُ مَنْ سَلِمَ الْمُسْلِمُونَ مِنْ لِسَانِهِ وَيَدِهِ، وَالْمُهَاجِرُ مَنْ هَجَرَ مَا نَهَى اللَّهُ عَنْهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: A Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hand other Muslims are safe, and the emigrant (Muhajir) is the one who gives up what Allah has forbidden.

hadiths.textArabic: يَسِّرُوا وَلاَ تُعَسِّرُوا، وَبَشِّرُوا وَلاَ تُنَفِّرُوا
hadiths.textEnglish: Make things easy for the people, and do not make it difficult for them, and give them glad tidings, and do not repel them.

hadiths.textArabic: أَفْضَلُ الأَعْمَالِ الصَّلاَةُ لِوَقْتِهَا، وَبِرُّ الْوَالِدَيْنِ، ثُمَّ الْجِهَادُ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The best deeds are: To offer prayers at their early fixed times, to be dutiful and kind to one's parents, and to fight in the cause of Allah.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا أُقِيمَتِ الصَّلاَةُ فَلاَ صَلاَةَ إِلاَّ الْمَكْتُوبَةَ
hadiths.textEnglish: When the Iqama is pronounced, there is no prayer except the obligatory one.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ بَلَغَهُ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ شَيْءٌ فَلْيُحَدِّثْ بِهِ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ عِنْدَهُ إِلاَّ كَذِبٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: The Prophet said: 'Whoever is asked about knowledge and conceals it will be bridled with a bridle of fire on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلاَ يُؤْذِ جَارَهُ، وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيُكْرِمْ ضَيْفَهُ، وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيَقُلْ خَيْرًا أَوْ لِيَصْمُتْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not harm his neighbor; whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his guest; and whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.

hadiths.textArabic: لَيْسَ الشَّدِيدُ بِالصُّرَعَةِ، إِنَّمَا الشَّدِيدُ الَّذِي يَمْلِكُ نَفْسَهُ عِنْدَ الْغَضَبِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The strong person is not the one who can wrestle someone else down. The strong person is the one who controls himself when he is angry.

hadiths.textArabic: خَيْرُكُمْ مَنْ تَعَلَّمَ الْقُرْآنَ وَعَلَّمَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: The best among you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.

hadiths.textArabic: الدُّنْيَا سِجْنُ الْمُؤْمِنِ وَجَنَّةُ الْكَافِرِ
hadiths.textEnglish: This world is a prison for the believer and a paradise for the disbeliever.

hadiths.textArabic: تَعِسَ عَبْدُ الدِّينَارِ وَعَبْدُ الدِّرْهَمِ وَعَبْدُ الْخَمِيصَةِ، إِنْ أُعْطِيَ رَضِيَ، وَإِنْ لَمْ يُعْطَ سَخِطَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Wretched is the slave of the dinar, and the slave of the dirham, and the slave of fine cloth. If he is given, he is pleased, and if he is not given, he is displeased.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ آمَنَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ، وَأَقَامَ الصَّلاَةَ، وَصَامَ رَمَضَانَ، كَانَ حَقًّا عَلَى اللَّهِ أَنْ يُدْخِلَهُ الْجَنَّةَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever believes in Allah and His Messenger, establishes prayer, and fasts Ramadan, it is obligatory upon Allah to admit him to Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَالَ: مَنْ عَادَى لِي وَلِيًّا فَقَدْ آذَنْتُهُ بِالْحَرْبِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Allah said: 'Whoever shows enmity to a friend of Mine, I shall be at war with him.'

hadiths.textArabic: مِنْ حُسْنِ إِسْلاَمِ الْمَرْءِ تَرْكُهُ مَا لاَ يَعْنِيهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Part of the perfection of someone's Islam is his leaving alone that which does not concern him.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا مَاتَ الإِنْسَانُ انْقَطَعَ عَمَلُهُ إِلاَّ مِنْ ثَلاَثٍ: صَدَقَةٍ جَارِيَةٍ، أَوْ عِلْمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ، أَوْ وَلَدٍ صَالِحٍ يَدْعُو لَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: When a person dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity, beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَامَ رَمَضَانَ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مَنْ لاَ يَأْمَنُ جَارُهُ بَوَائِقَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: He will not enter Paradise whose neighbor is not safe from his wrongful conduct.

hadiths.textArabic: حُجِبَتِ النَّارُ بِالشَّهَوَاتِ، وَحُجِبَتِ الْجَنَّةُ بِالْمَكَارِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The Fire is veiled by desires, and Paradise is veiled by hardships.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ مَاتَ وَلَمْ يَغْزُ، وَلَمْ يُحَدِّثْ نَفْسَهُ بِالْغَزْوِ، مَاتَ عَلَى شُعْبَةٍ مِنْ نِفَاقٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever dies without having fought in the cause of Allah or having had the intention to do so, dies upon a branch of hypocrisy.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ فَأَحْسَنَ الْوُضُوءَ ثُمَّ أَتَى الْجُمُعَةَ فَاسْتَمَعَ وَأَنْصَتَ غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الْجُمُعَةِ وَزِيَادَةُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever performs ablution properly, then comes to Friday prayer, listens attentively and remains silent, his sins between that Friday and the next will be forgiven, plus three more days.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لاَ يَنْظُرُ إِلَى صُوَرِكُمْ وَأَمْوَالِكُمْ وَلَكِنْ يَنْظُرُ إِلَى قُلُوبِكُمْ وَأَعْمَالِكُمْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Verily Allah does not look at your appearances or wealth, but rather He looks at your hearts and your deeds.

hadiths.textArabic: سَبْعَةٌ يُظِلُّهُمُ اللَّهُ فِي ظِلِّهِ يَوْمَ لاَ ظِلَّ إِلاَّ ظِلُّهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Seven people will be shaded by Allah under His shade on the Day when there will be no shade except His shade: a just ruler, a youth who grew up worshipping Allah, a person whose heart is attached to the mosque, two people who love each other for Allah's sake, a man who is tempted by a beautiful woman but says 'I fear Allah', a person who gives charity secretly, and a person who remembers Allah in seclusion and his eyes shed tears.

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُؤْمِنُ الْقَوِيُّ خَيْرٌ وَأَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الضَّعِيفِ، وَفِي كُلٍّ خَيْرٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, although there is goodness in both.

hadiths.textArabic: اتَّقُوا النَّارَ وَلَوْ بِشِقِّ تَمْرَةٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Protect yourselves from the Fire, even with half a date (in charity).

hadiths.textArabic: انْظُرُوا مُحَمَّدًا صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ فِي أَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Look at Muhammad and his care for his family.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ مِنْ أَكْمَلِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِيمَانًا أَحْسَنُهُمْ خُلُقًا
hadiths.textEnglish: The most complete of the believers in faith are those with the best character.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ حَجَّ لِلَّهِ فَلَمْ يَرْفُثْ وَلَمْ يَفْسُقْ رَجَعَ كَيَوْمِ وَلَدَتْهُ أُمُّهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever performs Hajj for the sake of Allah and does not commit any obscenity or wickedness will return as pure as the day his mother gave birth to him.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَامَ لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever stands in prayer on Laylat al-Qadr (Night of Decree) out of faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.

hadiths.textArabic: الْكَلِمَةُ الطَّيِّبَةُ صَدَقَةٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: A good word is charity.

hadiths.textArabic: سِبَابُ الْمُسْلِمِ فُسُوقٌ وَقِتَالُهُ كُفْرٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: Insulting a Muslim is wickedness and fighting him is disbelief.

hadiths.textArabic: لَوْلاَ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَى أُمَّتِي لَأَمَرْتُهُمْ بِالسِّوَاكِ عِنْدَ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Were it not that I would burden my nation, I would have commanded them to use the tooth-stick (siwak) before every prayer.

hadiths.textArabic: الإِيمَانُ بِضْعٌ وَسَبْعُونَ شُعْبَةً، وَالْحَيَاءُ شُعْبَةٌ مِنَ الإِيمَانِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Faith has seventy-odd branches, and modesty is a branch of faith.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا نَقَصَتْ صَدَقَةٌ مِنْ مَالٍ، وَمَا زَادَ اللَّهُ عَبْدًا بِعَفْوٍ إِلاَّ عِزًّا، وَمَا تَوَاضَعَ أَحَدٌ لِلَّهِ إِلاَّ رَفَعَهُ اللَّهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Charity does not decrease wealth; Allah increases a person in honor when he pardons others; and whoever is humble for Allah's sake, Allah elevates him.

hadiths.textArabic: وَاللَّهِ لَأَنْ يَهْدِيَ اللَّهُ بِكَ رَجُلاً وَاحِدًا خَيْرٌ لَكَ مِنْ حُمْرِ النَّعَمِ
hadiths.textEnglish: By Allah, if Allah guides one person through you, it is better for you than red camels (the most valuable possessions).

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَغَارُ، وَغَيْرَةُ اللَّهِ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ الْمُؤْمِنُ مَا حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Verily Allah is jealous, and Allah's jealousy is aroused when a believer does what Allah has forbidden.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا مِنْ نَبِيٍّ إِلاَّ قَدْ أُعْطِيَ مِنَ الآيَاتِ مَا مِثْلُهُ آمَنَ عَلَيْهِ الْبَشَرُ، وَإِنَّمَا كَانَ الَّذِي أُوتِيتُهُ وَحْيًا أَوْحَى اللَّهُ إِلَيَّ، فَأَرْجُو أَنْ أَكُونَ أَكْثَرَهُمْ تَابِعًا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: There was no prophet but was given signs by which people believed in him. What I have been given is the Divine Revelation which Allah revealed to me, and I hope that I will have the most followers on the Day of Resurrection.

hadiths.textArabic: إِيَّاكُمْ وَالْجُلُوسَ فِي الطُّرُقَاتِ، فَإِنْ أَبَيْتُمْ إِلاَّ الْمَجْلِسَ فَأَعْطُوا الطَّرِيقَ حَقَّهُ: غَضُّ الْبَصَرِ، وَكَفُّ الأَذَى، وَرَدُّ السَّلاَمِ، وَالأَمْرُ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ، وَالنَّهْيُ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Avoid sitting on the roads. If you must sit, then give the road its rights: lower your gaze, remove harm from the path, return greetings, enjoin good, and forbid evil.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ أَحْدَثَ فِي أَمْرِنَا هَذَا مَا لَيْسَ مِنْهُ فَهُوَ رَدٌّ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever introduces into this matter of ours (Islam) something that does not belong to it will have it rejected.
hadiths.chapter: I'tisam (Holding Fast to the Quran and Sunnah)

hadiths.textArabic: وَالَّذِي نَفْسِي بِيَدِهِ لاَ يُؤْمِنُ أَحَدُكُمْ حَتَّى أَكُونَ أَحَبَّ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ وَالِدِهِ وَوَلَدِهِ وَالنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
hadiths.textEnglish: By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, none of you believes until I am more beloved to him than his father, his child, and all people.

hadiths.textArabic: كَانَ خُلُقُهُ الْقُرْآنَ
hadiths.textEnglish: His character was the Quran (describing the Prophet's character).

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لاَ يَنْظُرُ إِلَى أَجْسَامِكُمْ وَلاَ إِلَى صُوَرِكُمْ وَلَكِنْ يَنْظُرُ إِلَى قُلُوبِكُمْ وَأَعْمَالِكُمْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Verily Allah does not look at your appearances or wealth, but rather He looks at your hearts and your deeds.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: كُلُّ مَعْرُوفٍ صَدَقَةٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: Every act of kindness is charity.

hadiths.textArabic: أَحَبُّ الأَعْمَالِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَدْوَمُهَا وَإِنْ قَلَّ
hadiths.textEnglish: The most beloved of deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if they are small.

hadiths.textArabic: مَثَلُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ فِي تَوَادِّهِمْ وَتَرَاحُمِهِمْ وَتَعَاطُفِهِمْ مَثَلُ الْجَسَدِ إِذَا اشْتَكَى مِنْهُ عُضْوٌ تَدَاعَى لَهُ سَائِرُ الْجَسَدِ بِالسَّهَرِ وَالْحُمَّى
hadiths.textEnglish: The believers, in their mutual love, mercy, and compassion, are like one body: if one part of it complains, the rest of the body responds with wakefulness and fever.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ سَلَكَ طَرِيقًا يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْمًا سَهَّلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِهِ طَرِيقًا إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever follows a path in the pursuit of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُؤْمِنُ الْقَوِيُّ خَيْرٌ وَأَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الضَّعِيفِ وَفِي كُلٍّ خَيْرٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, while there is good in both.

hadiths.textArabic: تُمِيطُ الأَذَى عَنِ الطَّرِيقِ صَدَقَةٌ، وَتَبَسُّمُكَ فِي وَجْهِ أَخِيكَ لَكَ صَدَقَةٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: Removing harm from the road is charity, and smiling in your brother's face is charity for you.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ تَحَاسَدُوا وَلاَ تَنَاجَشُوا وَلاَ تَبَاغَضُوا وَلاَ تَدَابَرُوا وَكُونُوا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ إِخْوَانًا
hadiths.textEnglish: Do not envy one another, do not artificially inflate prices against one another, do not hate one another, do not turn away from one another, and be servants of Allah as brothers.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: الْمَرْءُ عَلَى دِينِ خَلِيلِهِ فَلْيَنْظُرْ أَحَدُكُمْ مَنْ يُخَالِلُ
hadiths.textEnglish: A person is upon the religion of his close friend, so let each one of you look at whom he befriends.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُمْلِي لِلظَّالِمِ حَتَّى إِذَا أَخَذَهُ لَمْ يُفْلِتْهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Verily, Allah gives respite to the wrongdoer, but when He seizes him, He does not let him escape.

hadiths.textArabic: الإِسْلاَمُ أَنْ تَشْهَدَ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ وَتُقِيمَ الصَّلاَةَ وَتُؤْتِيَ الزَّكَاةَ وَتَصُومَ رَمَضَانَ وَتَحُجَّ الْبَيْتَ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ إِلَيْهِ سَبِيلاً
hadiths.textEnglish: Islam is to testify that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, to establish prayer, to give zakat, to fast Ramadan, and to perform pilgrimage to the House if you are able.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلاَ يُؤْذِ جَارَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not harm his neighbor.

hadiths.textArabic: الصَّلَوَاتُ الْخَمْسُ وَالْجُمُعَةُ إِلَى الْجُمُعَةِ وَرَمَضَانُ إِلَى رَمَضَانَ مُكَفِّرَاتٌ مَا بَيْنَهُنَّ إِذَا اجْتَنَبَ الْكَبَائِرَ
hadiths.textEnglish: The five daily prayers, Friday prayer to Friday prayer, and Ramadan to Ramadan are expiations for what comes between them, if major sins are avoided.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَتَلَ مُعَاهَدًا لَمْ يَرِحْ رَائِحَةَ الْجَنَّةِ، وَإِنَّ رِيحَهَا تُوجَدُ مِنْ مَسِيرَةِ أَرْبَعِينَ عَامًا
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever kills a person under covenant will not smell the fragrance of Paradise, although its fragrance can be detected from a distance of forty years.

hadiths.textArabic: حَقُّ الْمُسْلِمِ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ سِتٌّ: إِذَا لَقِيتَهُ فَسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ، وَإِذَا دَعَاكَ فَأَجِبْهُ، وَإِذَا اسْتَنْصَحَكَ فَانْصَحْ لَهُ، وَإِذَا عَطَسَ فَحَمِدَ اللَّهَ فَشَمِّتْهُ، وَإِذَا مَرِضَ فَعُدْهُ، وَإِذَا مَاتَ فَاتَّبِعْهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: The rights of a Muslim over another Muslim are six: when you meet him, greet him; when he invites you, respond; when he seeks your advice, advise him; when he sneezes and praises Allah, say 'Yarhamuk Allah'; when he is sick, visit him; and when he dies, follow his funeral.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ تَحْقِرَنَّ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ شَيْئًا وَلَوْ أَنْ تَلْقَى أَخَاكَ بِوَجْهٍ طَلْقٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Do not belittle any good deed, even meeting your brother with a cheerful face.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُسْلِمُ أَخُو الْمُسْلِمِ لاَ يَظْلِمُهُ وَلاَ يَخْذُلُهُ وَلاَ يَحْقِرُهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: A Muslim is the brother of a Muslim: he does not wrong him, he does not abandon him, and he does not look down upon him.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: التَّقْوَى هَاهُنَا - وَيُشِيرُ إِلَى صَدْرِهِ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Taqwa (piety/God-consciousness) is here - and he pointed to his chest three times.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ نَفَّسَ عَنْ مُؤْمِنٍ كُرْبَةً مِنْ كُرَبِ الدُّنْيَا نَفَّسَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ كُرْبَةً مِنْ كُرَبِ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever relieves a believer of a burden from the hardships of this world, Allah will relieve him of a burden from the hardships of the Day of Judgment.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ سَتَرَ مُسْلِمًا سَتَرَهُ اللَّهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah will conceal his faults on the Day of Judgment.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ تَابَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَطْلُعَ الشَّمْسُ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever repents before the sun rises from the west, Allah will accept his repentance.

hadiths.textArabic: يَا عِبَادِي إِنِّي حَرَّمْتُ الظُّلْمَ عَلَى نَفْسِي وَجَعَلْتُهُ بَيْنَكُمْ مُحَرَّمًا فَلاَ تَظَالَمُوا
hadiths.textEnglish: O My servants, I have forbidden oppression for Myself and have made it forbidden among you, so do not oppress one another.

hadiths.textArabic: كُلُّ بَنِي آدَمَ خَطَّاءٌ وَخَيْرُ الْخَطَّائِينَ التَّوَّابُونَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Every son of Adam sins, and the best of the sinners are those who repent.

hadiths.textArabic: الرَّاحِمُونَ يَرْحَمُهُمُ الرَّحْمَنُ، ارْحَمُوا مَنْ فِي الأَرْضِ يَرْحَمْكُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The merciful will be shown mercy by the Most Merciful. Be merciful to those on earth, and the One above the heavens will have mercy upon you.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يُبْسَطَ لَهُ فِي رِزْقِهِ وَيُنْسَأَ لَهُ فِي أَثَرِهِ فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever would like his provision to be increased and his life to be extended should maintain ties of kinship.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُسْلِمُ أَخُو الْمُسْلِمِ لاَ يَظْلِمُهُ وَلاَ يُسْلِمُهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: A Muslim is the brother of a Muslim: he does not wrong him or abandon him.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ كَانَ لأَخِيهِ عِنْدَهُ مَظْلِمَةٌ مِنْ عِرْضٍ أَوْ مَالٍ فَلْيَتَحَلَّلْهُ مِنْهُ الْيَوْمَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever has wronged his brother with regard to his honor or anything else should seek his forgiveness today (before it is too late).
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: مَا مِنْ يَوْمٍ يُصْبِحُ الْعِبَادُ فِيهِ إِلاَّ مَلَكَانِ يَنْزِلاَنِ فَيَقُولُ أَحَدُهُمَا: اللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِ مُنْفِقًا خَلَفًا، وَيَقُولُ الآخَرُ: اللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِ مُمْسِكًا تَلَفًا
hadiths.textEnglish: There is no day upon which the servants wake up except that two angels descend, one of them says: 'O Allah, give the one who spends a replacement,' and the other says: 'O Allah, give the one who withholds destruction.'

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ تَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوا، وَلاَ تُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا
hadiths.textEnglish: You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: اتَّقُوا الظُّلْمَ فَإِنَّ الظُّلْمَ ظُلُمَاتٌ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ، وَاتَّقُوا الشُّحَّ فَإِنَّ الشُّحَّ أَهْلَكَ مَنْ كَانَ قَبْلَكُمْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Beware of oppression, for oppression will be darkness on the Day of Resurrection. Beware of stinginess, for stinginess destroyed those who came before you.
hadiths.chapter: Righteousness and Maintaining Ties of Kinship

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا مَاتَ الإِنْسَانُ انْقَطَعَ عَمَلُهُ إِلاَّ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةٍ: صَدَقَةٍ جَارِيَةٍ، أَوْ عِلْمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ، أَوْ وَلَدٍ صَالِحٍ يَدْعُو لَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: When a person dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity (Sadaqah Jariyah), beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ أَحْدَثَ فِي أَمْرِنَا هَذَا مَا لَيْسَ مِنْهُ فَهُوَ رَدٌّ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever introduces into this matter of ours something that is not part of it will have it rejected.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ يَدَهُ بِاللَّيْلِ لِيَتُوبَ مُسِيءُ النَّهَارِ، وَيَبْسُطُ يَدَهُ بِالنَّهَارِ لِيَتُوبَ مُسِيءُ اللَّيْلِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Verily, Allah stretches out His Hand at night to accept the repentance of the one who sinned during the day, and He stretches out His Hand during the day to accept the repentance of the one who sinned at night.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ فَأَحْسَنَ الْوُضُوءَ خَرَجَتْ خَطَايَاهُ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ حَتَّى تَخْرُجَ مِنْ تَحْتِ أَظْفَارِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever performs ablution properly, his sins will depart from his body, even from under his fingernails.

hadiths.textArabic: الدُّعَاءُ سِلاَحُ الْمُؤْمِنِ وَعِمَادُ الدِّينِ وَنُورُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Supplication is the weapon of the believer, the pillar of the religion, and the light of the heavens and the earth.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَتَبَ الإِحْسَانَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَىْءٍ فَإِذَا قَتَلْتُمْ فَأَحْسِنُوا الْقِتْلَةَ وَإِذَا ذَبَحْتُمْ فَأَحْسِنُوا الذِّبْحَةَ وَلْيُحِدَّ أَحَدُكُمْ شَفْرَتَهُ وَلْيُرِحْ ذَبِيحَتَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Allah has prescribed excellence in everything. So when you kill, kill well, and when you slaughter, slaughter well. Let one of you sharpen his blade and spare suffering to the animal.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ غَشَّنَا فَلَيْسَ مِنَّا
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever deceives us is not one of us.

hadiths.textArabic: خَيْرُ الأَصْحَابِ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ خَيْرُهُمْ لِصَاحِبِهِ وَخَيْرُ الْجِيرَانِ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ خَيْرُهُمْ لِجَارِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The best of companions with Allah is the best of them to his companion, and the best of neighbors with Allah is the best of them to his neighbor.

hadiths.textArabic: أَعْطُوا الأَجِيرَ أَجْرَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَجِفَّ عَرَقُهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Give the worker his wages before his sweat dries.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا مِنْ مُسْلِمٍ يَغْرِسُ غَرْسًا أَوْ يَزْرَعُ زَرْعًا فَيَأْكُلُ مِنْهُ طَيْرٌ أَوْ إِنْسَانٌ أَوْ بَهِيمَةٌ إِلاَّ كَانَ لَهُ بِهِ صَدَقَةٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: No Muslim plants a tree or sows a crop, then a bird, person, or animal eats from it, except that it counts as charity for him.

hadiths.textArabic: الطُّهُورُ شَطْرُ الإِيمَانِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Purification is half of faith.

hadiths.textArabic: الدُّعَاءُ هُوَ الْعِبَادَةُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Supplication is worship.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلاَ يُؤْذِ جَارَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not harm his neighbor.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا سَافَرْتُمْ فِي الْخِصْبِ فَأَعْطُوا الإِبِلَ حَظَّهَا مِنَ الأَرْضِ وَإِذَا سَافَرْتُمْ فِي السَّنَةِ فَأَسْرِعُوا عَلَيْهَا السَّيْرَ
hadiths.textEnglish: When you travel in fertile land, give the camels their share of the earth. When you travel in times of drought, hurry them along.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ جَمِيلٌ يُحِبُّ الْجَمَالَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Allah is Beautiful and loves beauty.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا دَخَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ عَلَى أَخِيهِ الْمُسْلِمِ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ فَإِنْ حَالَتْ بَيْنَهُمَا شَجَرَةٌ أَوْ جِدَارٌ أَوْ حَجَرٌ ثُمَّ لَقِيَهُ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ أَيْضًا
hadiths.textEnglish: When one of you comes to his Muslim brother, let him greet him with peace. If a tree, wall, or stone comes between them, then he meets him again, let him greet him with peace again.

hadiths.textArabic: سَمِّ اللَّهَ وَكُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ وَكُلْ مِمَّا يَلِيكَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Mention Allah's name, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is nearest to you.

hadiths.textArabic: الْبَيِّعَانِ بِالْخِيَارِ مَا لَمْ يَتَفَرَّقَا
hadiths.textEnglish: The two parties in a business transaction have the option to cancel it as long as they have not separated.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ يَحِلُّ لِمُسْلِمٍ أَنْ يَهْجُرَ أَخَاهُ فَوْقَ ثَلاَثِ لَيَالٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: It is not permissible for a Muslim to forsake his brother for more than three nights.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ مِنْ أَحَبِّكُمْ إِلَيَّ وَأَقْرَبِكُمْ مِنِّي مَجْلِسًا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ أَحَاسِنَكُمْ أَخْلاَقًا
hadiths.textEnglish: The dearest and nearest among you to me on the Day of Resurrection will be those who are the best in manners and character.

hadiths.textArabic: التَّاجِرُ الصَّدُوقُ الأَمِينُ مَعَ النَّبِيِّينَ وَالصِّدِّيقِينَ وَالشُّهَدَاءِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The truthful and trustworthy merchant will be with the prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيَقُلْ خَيْرًا أَوْ لِيَصْمُتْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.

hadiths.textArabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا وَتَصَدَّقُوا وَالْبَسُوا فِي غَيْرِ إِسْرَافٍ وَلاَ مَخِيلَةٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Eat, drink, give charity, and wear clothes without extravagance or arrogance.

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُؤْمِنُ الْقَوِيُّ خَيْرٌ وَأَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الضَّعِيفِ وَفِي كُلٍّ خَيْرٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, though there is good in both.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ رَفِيقٌ يُحِبُّ الرِّفْقَ وَيُعْطِي عَلَى الرِّفْقِ مَا لاَ يُعْطِي عَلَى الْعُنْفِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Allah is gentle and loves gentleness. He gives for gentleness what He does not give for harshness.

hadiths.textArabic: رَحِمَ اللَّهُ رَجُلاً سَمْحًا إِذَا بَاعَ وَإِذَا اشْتَرَى وَإِذَا اقْتَضَى
hadiths.textEnglish: May Allah have mercy on a man who is easy-going when he sells, when he buys, and when he asks for repayment.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا أُعْطِيَ أَحَدٌ عَطَاءً خَيْرًا وَأَوْسَعَ مِنَ الصَّبْرِ
hadiths.textEnglish: No one has been given a gift better and more abundant than patience.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ تَشَبَّهَ بِقَوْمٍ فَهُوَ مِنْهُمْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever imitates a people is one of them.

hadiths.textArabic: خَيْرُكُمْ خَيْرُكُمْ لأَهْلِهِ وَأَنَا خَيْرُكُمْ لأَهْلِي
hadiths.textEnglish: The best of you are those who are best to their families, and I am the best of you to my family.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا دَخَلْتُمْ بُيُوتًا فَسَلِّمُوا عَلَى أَنْفُسِكُمْ تَحِيَّةً مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ مُبَارَكَةً طَيِّبَةً
hadiths.textEnglish: When you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon yourselves - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ طَعَامًا فَلْيَقُلِ اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْرًا مِنْهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: When one of you eats food, let him say: O Allah, bless us in it and feed us with something better than it.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّمَا بُعِثْتُ لأُتَمِّمَ مَكَارِمَ الأَخْلاَقِ
hadiths.textEnglish: I was sent only to perfect good character.

hadiths.textArabic: أَحَبُّ النَّاسِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَنْفَعُهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The most beloved people to Allah are those most beneficial to people.

hadiths.textArabic: الْمُؤْمِنُ غِرٌّ كَرِيمٌ وَالْفَاجِرُ خِبٌّ لَئِيمٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: The believer is simple and generous, while the wicked person is deceitful and ignoble.

hadiths.textArabic: الأَمَانَةُ غِنًى وَالْخِيَانَةُ فَقْرٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: Trustworthiness is richness, and treachery is poverty.

hadiths.textArabic: الْحَيَاءُ مِنَ الإِيمَانِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Modesty is part of faith.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ لاَ يَشْكُرُ النَّاسَ لاَ يَشْكُرُ اللَّهَ
hadiths.textEnglish: He who does not thank people does not thank Allah.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ يَقُولُ أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ إِلاَّ غُفِرَ لَهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ
hadiths.textEnglish: There is no servant who says: I seek forgiveness from Allah, the One besides whom there is none worthy of worship, the Living, the Sustainer, and I repent to Him - except that he will be forgiven, even if he fled from battle.

hadiths.textArabic: جَنَّةُ الْمَرْءِ وَنَارُهُ لِسَانُهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: A person's paradise and hellfire are his tongue.

hadiths.textArabic: صِلَةُ الرَّحِمِ تَزِيدُ فِي الْعُمُرِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Maintaining family ties increases one's lifespan.

hadiths.textArabic: الْكَرِيمُ ابْنُ الْكَرِيمِ ابْنِ الْكَرِيمِ ابْنِ الْكَرِيمِ يُوسُفُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
hadiths.textEnglish: The noble one, son of the noble one, son of the noble one, son of the noble one: Yusuf son of Yaqub son of Ishaq son of Ibrahim.

hadiths.textArabic: السَّخِيُّ قَرِيبٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ قَرِيبٌ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ قَرِيبٌ مِنَ النَّاسِ بَعِيدٌ مِنَ النَّارِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The generous person is close to Allah, close to Paradise, close to people, and far from the Fire.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ الصَّبْرَ عِنْدَ الصَّدْمَةِ الأُولَى
hadiths.textEnglish: Indeed, patience is at the first strike of calamity.

hadiths.textArabic: أَلاَ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَى مَا يَمْحُو اللَّهُ بِهِ الْخَطَايَا وَيَرْفَعُ بِهِ الدَّرَجَاتِ إِسْبَاغُ الْوُضُوءِ عَلَى الْمَكَارِهِ وَكَثْرَةُ الْخُطَا إِلَى الْمَسَاجِدِ وَانْتِظَارُ الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الصَّلاَةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Shall I not guide you to what Allah erases sins with and raises ranks by? Performing ablution thoroughly despite difficulties, taking many steps to the mosque, and waiting for prayer after prayer.

hadiths.textArabic: أَحَبُّ الأَعْمَالِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَدْوَمُهَا وَإِنْ قَلَّ
hadiths.textEnglish: The most beloved deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if they are small.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا يَزَالُ لِسَانُكَ رَطْبًا مِنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Keep your tongue moist with the remembrance of Allah.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَرَأَ حَرْفًا مِنْ كِتَابِ اللَّهِ فَلَهُ بِهِ حَسَنَةٌ وَالْحَسَنَةُ بِعَشْرِ أَمْثَالِهَا
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever recites a letter from the Book of Allah, he will receive one good deed as ten good deeds like it.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ سَأَلَ اللَّهَ الْجَنَّةَ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ قَالَتِ الْجَنَّةُ اللَّهُمَّ أَدْخِلْهُ الْجَنَّةَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever asks Allah for Paradise three times, Paradise says: O Allah, admit him to Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا تَرَكَ عَبْدٌ شَيْئًا لِلَّهِ إِلاَّ عَوَّضَهُ اللَّهُ خَيْرًا مِنْهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: No servant leaves something for the sake of Allah except that Allah compensates him with something better than it.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ نَفَّسَ عَنْ مُؤْمِنٍ كُرْبَةً مِنْ كُرَبِ الدُّنْيَا نَفَّسَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ كُرْبَةً مِنْ كُرَبِ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever relieves a believer of distress in this world, Allah will relieve him of distress on the Day of Resurrection.

hadiths.textArabic: أَكْمَلُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِيمَانًا أَحْسَنُهُمْ خُلُقًا
hadiths.textEnglish: The most complete of believers in faith are those best in character.

hadiths.textArabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدَى وَالتُّقَى وَالْعَفَافَ وَالْغِنَى
hadiths.textEnglish: O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and self-sufficiency.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَلَّى الْعِشَاءَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَامَ نِصْفَ اللَّيْلِ وَمَنْ صَلَّى الصُّبْحَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا صَلَّى اللَّيْلَ كُلَّهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever prays Isha in congregation, it is as if he stood half the night in prayer. And whoever prays Fajr in congregation, it is as if he prayed the whole night.

hadiths.textArabic: التَّوْبَةُ تَجُبُّ مَا كَانَ قَبْلَهَا
hadiths.textEnglish: Repentance wipes out what came before it.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَرَأَ بِالآيَتَيْنِ مِنْ آخِرِ سُورَةِ الْبَقَرَةِ فِي لَيْلَةٍ كَفَتَاهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever recites the last two verses of Surat al-Baqarah at night, they will suffice him.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ تَحَاسَدُوا وَلاَ تَنَاجَشُوا وَلاَ تَبَاغَضُوا وَلاَ تَدَابَرُوا وَكُونُوا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ إِخْوَانًا
hadiths.textEnglish: Do not envy one another, do not artificially inflate prices, do not hate one another, do not turn away from one another, and be servants of Allah as brothers.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَامَ بِعَشْرِ آيَاتٍ لَمْ يُكْتَبْ مِنَ الْغَافِلِينَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever stands in prayer with ten verses will not be written among the heedless.

hadiths.textArabic: بُنِيَ الإِسْلاَمُ عَلَى خَمْسٍ شَهَادَةِ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ وَإِقَامِ الصَّلاَةِ وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ وَحَجِّ الْبَيْتِ وَصَوْمِ رَمَضَانَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Islam is built upon five: testifying that there is no deity except Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, establishing prayer, giving zakah, Hajj to the House, and fasting Ramadan.

hadiths.textArabic: صَلُّوا كَمَا رَأَيْتُمُونِي أُصَلِّي
hadiths.textEnglish: Pray as you have seen me praying.

hadiths.textArabic: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ رَبِّهِ وَهُوَ سَاجِدٌ فَأَكْثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ
hadiths.textEnglish: The closest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so increase supplication therein.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَامَ رَمَضَانَ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever fasts Ramadan with faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.

hadiths.textArabic: خَيْرُ الصَّدَقَةِ مَا كَانَ عَنْ ظَهْرِ غِنًى
hadiths.textEnglish: The best charity is that given when one is self-sufficient.

hadiths.textArabic: الْحَجُّ عَرَفَةُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Hajj is Arafah.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ صَلاَةَ لِمَنْ لَمْ يَقْرَأْ بِفَاتِحَةِ الْكِتَابِ
hadiths.textEnglish: There is no prayer for one who does not recite the opening chapter of the Book.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ يَقْبَلُ اللَّهُ صَلاَةً بِغَيْرِ طُهُورٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Allah does not accept prayer without purification.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَامَ رَمَضَانَ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever stands in prayer during Ramadan with faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَلَّى الْفَجْرَ فَهُوَ فِي ذِمَّةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever prays Fajr is under the protection of Allah.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَلَّى الْبَرْدَيْنِ دَخَلَ الْجَنَّةَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever prays the two cool prayers will enter Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: رَكْعَتَا الْفَجْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا وَمَا فِيهَا
hadiths.textEnglish: The two rakahs before Fajr are better than this world and what is in it.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَامَ يَوْمًا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ بَاعَدَ اللَّهُ وَجْهَهُ عَنِ النَّارِ سَبْعِينَ خَرِيفًا
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever fasts one day in the path of Allah, Allah will distance his face from the Fire by seventy autumns.

hadiths.textArabic: الصَّدَقَةُ تُطْفِئُ الْخَطِيئَةَ كَمَا يُطْفِئُ الْمَاءُ النَّارَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Charity extinguishes sin as water extinguishes fire.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ حَافَظَ عَلَى الصَّلَوَاتِ الْخَمْسِ دَخَلَ الْجَنَّةَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever maintains the five daily prayers will enter Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: لاَ تَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوا وَلاَ تُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا
hadiths.textEnglish: You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَلَّى اثْنَتَىْ عَشْرَةَ رَكْعَةً فِي يَوْمٍ وَلَيْلَةٍ بُنِيَ لَهُ بِهِنَّ بَيْتٌ فِي الْجَنَّةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever prays twelve rakahs during the day and night, a house will be built for him in Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: أَوَّلُ مَا يُحَاسَبُ بِهِ الْعَبْدُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ الصَّلاَةُ
hadiths.textEnglish: The first thing the servant will be accountable for on the Day of Resurrection is prayer.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ صَلَّى الصُّبْحَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا صَلَّى اللَّيْلَ كُلَّهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever prays Fajr in congregation, it is as if he prayed the whole night.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا تَوَضَّأَ الْعَبْدُ الْمُسْلِمُ أَوِ الْمُؤْمِنُ فَغَسَلَ وَجْهَهُ خَرَجَ مِنْ وَجْهِهِ كُلُّ خَطِيئَةٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: When a Muslim or believer performs ablution and washes his face, every sin exits from his face.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ أَذَّنَ اثْنَتَىْ عَشْرَةَ سَنَةً وَجَبَتْ لَهُ الْجَنَّةُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever calls the adhan for twelve years, Paradise is guaranteed for him.

hadiths.textArabic: الصَّلاَةُ خَيْرُ مَوْضُوعٍ فَمَنِ اسْتَطَاعَ أَنْ يَسْتَكْثِرَ فَلْيَسْتَكْثِرْ
hadiths.textEnglish: Prayer is the best thing established, so whoever is able to do more of it, let him do more.

hadiths.textArabic: بَشِّرِ الْمَشَّائِينَ فِي الظُّلَمِ إِلَى الْمَسَاجِدِ بِالنُّورِ التَّامِّ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Give glad tidings of complete light on the Day of Resurrection to those who walk in darkness to the mosques.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ قَامَ لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever stands in prayer on Laylat al-Qadr with faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمُ الْمُؤَذِّنَ فَقُولُوا مِثْلَ مَا يَقُولُ
hadiths.textEnglish: When you hear the muadhdhin, repeat what he says.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ أَذَّنَ مُحْتَسِبًا يَبْتَغِي بِذَلِكَ وَجْهَ اللَّهِ أُعْطِيَ مِثْلَ أَجْرِ مَنِ اسْتَمَعَ إِلَيْهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever calls the adhan seeking Allah's countenance will be given the same reward as those who listen to it.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ سَلَكَ طَرِيقًا يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْمًا سَهَّلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ طَرِيقًا إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever travels a path seeking knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.

hadiths.textArabic: طَلَبُ الْعِلْمِ فَرِيضَةٌ عَلَى كُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim.

hadiths.textArabic: الْعُلَمَاءُ وَرَثَةُ الأَنْبِيَاءِ إِنَّ الأَنْبِيَاءَ لَمْ يُورِثُوا دِينَارًا وَلاَ دِرْهَمًا وَإِنَّمَا وَرَّثُوا الْعِلْمَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Scholars are the heirs of the prophets. The prophets do not leave behind dinars or dirhams, but they leave behind knowledge.

hadiths.textArabic: كُنْ فِي الدُّنْيَا كَأَنَّكَ غَرِيبٌ أَوْ عَابِرُ سَبِيلٍ
hadiths.textEnglish: Be in this world as if you are a stranger or a traveler passing through.

hadiths.textArabic: لَوْ كَانَ لاِبْنِ آدَمَ وَادِيَانِ مِنْ ذَهَبٍ لاَبْتَغَى وَادِيًا ثَالِثًا وَلاَ يَمْلأُ فَاهُ إِلاَّ التُّرَابُ
hadiths.textEnglish: If the son of Adam had two valleys of gold, he would seek a third valley. Nothing will fill his mouth except dust.

hadiths.textArabic: اصْبِرْ عَلَى مَا أَصَابَكَ إِنَّ ذَلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ الأُمُورِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Be patient with what befalls you, for that is among the matters requiring resolve.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ مَاتَ وَعَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ فَإِنَّهُ يُؤْخَذُ مِنْ حَسَنَاتِهِ لَيْسَ ثَمَّ دِينَارٌ وَلاَ دِرْهَمٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever dies with a debt, it will be taken from his good deeds. There are no dinars or dirhams there.

hadiths.textArabic: الْبَيِّعَانِ بِالْخِيَارِ مَا لَمْ يَتَفَرَّقَا فَإِنْ صَدَقَا وَبَيَّنَا بُورِكَ لَهُمَا فِي بَيْعِهِمَا
hadiths.textEnglish: The two parties in a transaction have the option as long as they have not separated. If they are truthful and clarify, their transaction will be blessed.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَأْكُلْ بِيَمِينِهِ وَإِذَا شَرِبَ فَلْيَشْرَبْ بِيَمِينِهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: When one of you eats, let him eat with his right hand. When he drinks, let him drink with his right hand.

hadiths.textArabic: مَا مَلأَ آدَمِيٌّ وِعَاءً شَرًّا مِنْ بَطْنٍ حَسْبُ الآدَمِيِّ لُقَيْمَاتٌ يُقِمْنَ صُلْبَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: The son of Adam has not filled a vessel worse than his stomach. Sufficient for him are a few morsels to keep his back straight.

hadiths.textArabic: الشِّفَاءُ فِي ثَلاَثَةٍ شَرْبَةِ عَسَلٍ وَشَرْطَةِ مِحْجَمٍ وَكَيَّةِ نَارٍ وَأَنْهَى أُمَّتِي عَنِ الْكَيِّ
hadiths.textEnglish: Healing is in three things: a drink of honey, cupping, and cauterization with fire. But I forbid my nation from cauterization.

hadiths.textArabic: إِذَا نَكَحَ أَحَدُكُمُ امْرَأَةً أَوِ اشْتَرَى خَادِمًا فَلْيَقُلِ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: When one of you marries a woman or buys a servant, let him say: O Allah, I ask You for her goodness and the goodness You created in her.

hadiths.textArabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ إِذَا عَمِلَ أَحَدُكُمْ عَمَلاً أَنْ يُتْقِنَهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Allah loves that when one of you does something, he does it with excellence.

hadiths.textArabic: الدُّنْيَا سِجْنُ الْمُؤْمِنِ وَجَنَّةُ الْكَافِرِ
hadiths.textEnglish: This world is the prison of the believer and the paradise of the disbeliever.

hadiths.textArabic: بَادِرُوا بِالأَعْمَالِ فِتَنًا كَقِطَعِ اللَّيْلِ الْمُظْلِمِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Hasten to do good deeds before trials come like pieces of dark night.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ عَلَّمَ عِلْمًا فَلَهُ أَجْرُ مَنْ عَمِلَ بِهِ لاَ يَنْقُصُ مِنْ أَجْرِ الْعَامِلِ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever teaches knowledge will have the reward of the one who acts upon it, without diminishing the reward of the doer.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ بَاعَ بَيْعَتَيْنِ فِي بَيْعَةٍ فَلَهُ أَوْكَسُهُمَا أَوِ الرِّبَا
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever makes two sales in one, he gets the lesser of the two or it is riba.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ غَدَا إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ لاَ يُرِيدُ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ خَيْرًا أَوْ يُعَلِّمَهُ كَانَ لَهُ كَأَجْرِ حَاجٍّ تَامًّا حَجُّهُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever goes to the mosque intending only to learn or teach good, he will have the reward of a perfect Hajj.

hadiths.textArabic: الصَّبْرُ ضِيَاءٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: Patience is light.

hadiths.textArabic: حَقُّ الْمُسْلِمِ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ سِتٌّ قِيلَ مَا هُنَّ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قَالَ إِذَا لَقِيتَهُ فَسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The rights of one Muslim over another are six. It was said: What are they, O Messenger of Allah? He said: When you meet him, greet him with peace.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ أَصْبَحَ آمِنًا فِي سِرْبِهِ مُعَافًى فِي جَسَدِهِ عِنْدَهُ قُوتُ يَوْمِهِ فَكَأَنَّمَا حِيزَتْ لَهُ الدُّنْيَا بِحَذَافِيرِهَا
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever wakes up secure in his property, healthy in his body, with food for the day, it is as if the whole world has been gathered for him.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ مَظْلَمَةٌ لأَخِيهِ مِنْ عِرْضِهِ أَوْ شَىْءٍ فَلْيَتَحَلَّلْهُ مِنْهُ الْيَوْمَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever has wronged his brother in honor or anything else, let him seek his pardon today.

hadiths.textArabic: لَيْسَ الشَّدِيدُ بِالصُّرَعَةِ إِنَّمَا الشَّدِيدُ الَّذِي يَمْلِكُ نَفْسَهُ عِنْدَ الْغَضَبِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The strong person is not the one who can overpower others. Rather, the strong person is the one who controls himself when angry.

hadiths.textArabic: النِّكَاحُ سُنَّتِي فَمَنْ لَمْ يَعْمَلْ بِسُنَّتِي فَلَيْسَ مِنِّي
hadiths.textEnglish: Marriage is my sunnah. Whoever does not follow my sunnah is not from me.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ خَرَجَ فِي طَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ فَهُوَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever goes out seeking knowledge is in the path of Allah until he returns.

hadiths.textArabic: مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا أَحَبَّهُ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ زَهِدَ فِيمَا عِنْدَ النَّاسِ أَحَبَّهُ النَّاسُ
hadiths.textEnglish: Whoever is ascetic regarding the world, Allah will love him. Whoever is ascetic regarding what people have, people will love him.
